title: Amorphophallus titanum
summary: Amorphophallus titanum, the titan arum, is a flowering plant in  the family Araceae. It has the largest unbranched inflorescence in the world. The inflorescence of the talipot palm, Corypha umbraculifera, is larger, but it is branched rather than unbranched. Amorphophallus titanum is endemic to Sumatra.
